titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Isaac Mann Autograph Collection
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke Staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The collection consists of 86 documents, mostly letters, gathered by Mann for their signatures. Most of the individuals represented are clergymen or preachers, particularly Baptists, and include Abraham Booth, Christmas Evans, Samuel Kilpin, John Ryland, and Basil Woodd.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Bequest of James Marshall and Marie-Louise Osborn. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Isaac Mann Autograph Collection is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Isaac Mann Autograph Collection. James Marshall and Marie-Louise Osborn Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

bioghist.head: ISAAC MANN, 1785-1831 (COLLECTOR)
bioghist.p: Isaac Mann, was born in 1785 and joined the Particular (Reformed) Baptist Church at Bridlington in Yorkshire during the ministry of Robert Harness of Hull. He was the first student admitted to the new Horton Academy in April, 1805. After brief pastorates at Steep Lane, Burslem, and Shipley Baptist churches, Mann returned to Horton as tutor in Classics in 1816. He was named Secretary to the Northern (Baptist) Education Society in 1822, and became pastor at Maze Pond Chapel in London in 1826. Mann died in London in 1831.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Isaac Mann Autograph Collection consists of letters and documents by religious figures, especially Baptist or Particular Baptist ministers, collected by Isaac Mann, himself a Particular Baptist minister. The collection spans the dates 1750-1849 and the items have been arranged alphabetically by author.

With the exception of a few notes to Mann concerning his search for autograph material, there are no letters to Mann himself in the collection. It does contain letters to and by several influential Baptist missionaries and their supporters, including David Brown, William Bull, William Carey, Christmas Evans, Andrew Fuller, and Samuel Pearce. An 1807 letter by Carey, for example, discusses the sale in England of his Sanskrit grammar and translation of the Ramayana . A number of letters are requests for assistance from or comments on the work of the Particular Baptist Fund. One such letter, addressed by Benjamin Tomkins on behalf of the Fund to the Rev. Thomas Linford of Bottsford, requests a "sincere, but also satisfactory" answer to the the Fund's concerns about Linford's teachings on the Moral Law.

There are several letters by Abraham Booth, pastor of Little Prescot-Street church in London, including defenses of his Glad Tidings to Perishing Sinners, or, the Genuine Gospel a Complete Warrant for the Ungodly to Believe in Jesus and a comment that American "metaphysical theology" may "issue in doctrinal Arminianism, and practical Antinomianism."

John Ryland (1753-1825), pastor of Broadmead, Bristol, is represented by eight items, including a 1796 letter commenting on Robertson's Historical Disquisition , notes on some scripture verses, and a short text in question and answer format on John 6:37 titled "Come and Welcome to Jesus Christ."

One of the few items by a non-Baptist is the earliest item in the collection, a sermon fragment in the hand of the Nonconforming minister Philip Henry (1631-1696). Another is a March 13, 1849 letter by the Rev. James Shore of the Free Church of England, written during his imprisonment at Exeter Gaol for preaching without a license. Addressed to the Rev. John Blackburn, the letter states that Shore is "very happy in his cell" and expresses his hope for the "entire liberation of religion from secular influence."

Other material includes an undated sermon fragment in the hand of \ Philip Henry (1631-1696); the deathbed letter of the Rev. Joseph Stennett to his parishioners; a letter by the Rev. Alexander Waugh discussing his own early religious exercises; and an incomplete notebook of "Poems on Several Occasions" and "Juvenilia," with notes on metrics, by Thomas Gibbons.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letters and Documents is arranged alphabetically by author.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gives corrections on text of recipient's address.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Concerns the possibility of Harness's taking the Baptist church in Broseley, Shropshire.

did.unittitle: ALS to John Webster Morris; London

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Returns a MS of Samuel Hopkins and defends himself against its arguments.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Concerns the possible publication of Mr. Rowles's answer to a tract by Joshua Toulmin.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Defends himself against misrepresentations in a MS on justification by Dr. Hopkins and criticizes metaphysical theology of American authors which might lead to Arminianism.

did.unittitle: ALS to Betsey and Mary Wightman; London

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Sends a parcel of their grandmother's clothes and advises on their deportment.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Receipt for L110.10.5 to Particular Baptist Fund.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Encloses some addresses.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Asks about progress of translations of Bible into languages of India.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Reports that he is unable to admit a recommended student to Newport Pagnell Academy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: About William Carey's missionary efforts.

did.unittitle: Petition to the Managers of the Particular Baptist Fund; Moulton

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph. Acknowledges receipt of gift and solicits further aid.

did.unittitle: Petition to the Managers of the Particular Baptist Fund; Moulton

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph. Petitions for an allowance "for the Purchase of Books necessary for a Minister." With signed recommendation by John Evans and John Ryland.

did.unittitle: Two petitions to the Managers of the Particular Baptist Fund; Leicester

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph. Acknowledges receipt of a donation and solicits further aid. Also signed by Deacons and members of the Baptist Church in Leicester.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gives instructions for selling the first volume of his Ramayana and Sanskrit grammer, and relates plans for translations of the Bible.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Concerns votes by proxy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Sends pamphlets (not present) about American theology.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Sends pamphlets (not present) about American theology.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Reviews his ministry in the last year, his gifts from the Baptist Fund, and his state of health. Followed by an ALS to the Managers of the Particular Baptist Fund, dated 1829 Jan 4, giving a short summary of his faith and soliciting further aid.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph. Also signed by Joseph Harris and Timothy Thomas. Supports effort to gather books to aid ministry in Gower, Glamorganshire.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: About efforts to get signatures for a petition to Parliament for the protection of the Baptist Mission in India.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Concerns collections for the Baptist Missionary Society and giving news about William Carey's effort in India.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: With references to several Baptists and translations of the Bible.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph. Concerning the Baptist Missionary Society. Accompanied by partial minutes of a meeting of the Baptist Missionary Society.

did.unittitle: ALS to Mr. Baker; Bunhill Row

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter to a man facing death.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph. Concerning original verses and comments on poetry. Incomplete, lacking leaves of beginning.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Explains why he has abandoned plans for his publication.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph fragment.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph. Endorsed by Isaac Mann.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Urges him to preach to a man about to be executed and discusses the cost of building chapels.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Enquires about magazine proofs and mourns the death of a mutual friend.

did.unittitle: ALS to Rev. Thomas Thomas; Hans Place

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Declines an invitation to preach.

did.unittitle: ALS to John Paxson; Hans Place

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Declines an unstated request.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Responds to requests to preach.

did.unittitle: ALS to Isaac Mann; Grove Lane

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Sends two or three autographs, now missing, of men "who will probably be remembered when the hand which now writes this will be mouldering in the dust."

did.unittitle: ALS to the Rev. John Clayton

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Asks him to second the resolution of thanks to the Vice President at an upcoming meeting, possibly the British and Foreign Bible Society.

did.unittitle: AL (3d person) to Messrs. Cadell and Davies; Fulham

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Requests 25 copies of his Travels to be sent to John Bacon, Esq.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Sends recommendations for advice to be sent by Baptist Missionary Society to their missionaries. Printed in Fuller's Memoirs ... of Samuel Pearce .

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Reports the news he has received from William Carey in India on the Baptist Missions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Concerns the printing of an edition of his Persuasives to early piety being executed by Richard Baynes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Sends the autograph (still present) of Thomas Spencer, "the fifth edition of whose life goes to press ... on Monday," and comments on Mann's autograph collection.

did.unittitle: ALS to Rev. G. B. Kidd; Liverpool

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Expresses willingness to conduct service.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Invitation to dine.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Arranges a time for Mann to preach.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Concerns the need of a grant from the Particular Baptist Fund for the chapel at Uppenham.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: With notes, possibly for a sermon, by Ryland.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: With comments on Robertson's Historical Disquisitions ... 1791, and accompanied by sermon notes on various scripture passages, 1783 or ca. 1800.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Concerns efforts to find another church for Mr. Tyso.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Sends Bristol Petitions (now absent) to be placed before Parliament by Richard Davis and Edward Protheroe.

did.unittitle: ALS to the Rev. Mr. Sutcliff

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Inquires into Sutcliff's activities, with comments on various Baptist divines and articles in the Evangelical Magazine.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Requests back issues of a periodical on Baptist missions and chronicles religious meetings.

did.unittitle: ALS to the Rev. Mr. Wilcocks

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: About a collection for poor ministers, with the money to go to Mr. Cocks of Culstock.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gives his opinion of the case between the Barnstaple Baptist Church and Mr. John's.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter commends the ministry of Mr. Bradley, Baptist divine. Also signed by John Sharp.

did.unittitle: Petition to the Managers of the Particular Baptist Fund, signed on behalf of the church at Cardington, Bedford, Cardington

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Solicits further aid and claims greater need on account of the death of John Howard, who had contributed to the church.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Writes from the Exeter Gaol, where he had been imprisoned for his actions in trying to effect the "liberation of religion from secular influence."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph. Endorsed by Simpson's son, David Simpson, and by Isaac Mann.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Responds to queries of Hirst about Baptist meetings in Bolton.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Recommends Mr. Tomkins to the Committee of the Stepney Baptist Academy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Asks Davis if he will preach in Stearne's church the following Sunday.

did.unittitle: ALS to W. Paxson; Fen Court

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter of introduction.

did.unittitle: LS to the Church of Christ meeting in Little Wild Street, London, Bath

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Dictated and signed by Joseph Stennett, and written by Samuel Stennett. A farewell letter to his congregation before his death.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Answers a query about the Baptist Church in Little Wild Street.

did.unittitle: ALS to the Church of Christ meeting in Little Wild Street; Bartholomew Close

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Accepts their call to be minister.

did.unittitle: ALS to Gilbert Pudner; Muswell Hill
ALS to the Rev. T. Griffin

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Applies for support and inquires about a church in which to serve.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Reports to Baptist Missionary Society on his efforts in India.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gives facts about the career of Joseph Stennett.

did.unittitle: Letter (copy) to the Rev. Thomas Linford

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Inquires on behalf of the Managers of the Particular Baptist Fund whether Linford believes moral law to be the rule of a Christian's moral conduct. Copy by Abraham Booth.

did.unittitle: ALS to the Rev. James Churchill

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Regrets that he is unable to preach at Dillon and sends sympathy to Mr. Churchill during his distress.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Recalls his religious experience as a child. Accompanied by copy in another hand.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Announces a sermon on the American revival.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Discusses possibility of interdenominational approach to missionary work.
